name: The Malevolent Lord of the Abyss (Bard 10 / Pale Master 20 / Blackguard 10)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Malevolent Lord of the Abyss



Image source: https://mfiles.alphacoders.com/595/595204.jpg

Hello again! Hope you are all keeping well! 

I think this a very fun build idea for a very evil character:

Blackguard for great proficiencies, nice saves, free CL 10 bulls / day, summon undead and outsiders
Pale Master for very high AC, crit/sneak/stun immunity, summon more undead, epic warding / epic mage armor
Bard for some spell casting including improved invisibility, haste, darkness/ultravision, prot v evil, craft wand, bard song, nice skill dumps

I manage to squeeze 20 PM levels into the build and Str 30 (capped at 42), mundane 41 AB (effective 47 AB with taunt), 400hp+, all saves above 20, saves double buff-able up to +12 (with CHA + other stat) plus +9 against spells, 284 skill points.

I put the Int to 16, even with human, there never seemed to be enough skill points. If one doesn't want taunt, one could increase Con to 16 (+40 hp +1 fort) or Cha to 16 (+1 to saves).

I think there could be great synergy with the summons for flanking sneak attacks and the darkness spell (which can be cast without arcane spell failure in full armor and has no save apart from spell resistance, or immunity from ultravision), ultravision/blind fight, and the 3d6 sneak attack from Blackguard 10.

Went two handed as there is +20 AC from PM 20 and Tumble 40.

This is another variant, going very very high PM. 
I put in a dragon summon, a lich lord who can cast CL 20 wizard spells, extra AC and greater ruin 1/day to cast when you like.
Doesn't have as good bardic spellcasting, loses 1 AB still has 4 APR. 
Both have UMD, the bard spells seem like a bonus. All the PM goodies come much earlier (ie PM 10 at lvl 24). 
Overall I like this one better than the first one.
